billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Relates to filing requirements for fiscal notes
summary: Requires that a copy of the statutorily required fiscal note on retirement bills, signed by the appropriate actuary, be filed with the journal clerks of the Senate and Assembly.

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in relation to the fiscal note

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 50 of the legislative law, as added by chapter 503
    2  of the laws of 1971, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 50.  Fiscal note in retirement bills.  A bill which enacts or amends
    4  any provision of law relating to a retirement  system  or  plan  of  the
    5  state  of New York or of any of its political subdivisions shall contain
    6  a fiscal note stating the estimated annual cost to the employer affected
    7  and the source of such estimate. A COPY OF SUCH FISCAL NOTE,  SIGNED  BY
    8  THE  APPROPRIATE  ACTUARY,  SHALL BE FILED WITH THE JOURNAL CLERK OF THE
    9  SENATE AND THE JOURNAL CLERK IN THE ASSEMBLY.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2266

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the legislative law, in relation to the fiscal note

SUMMARY:
This bill would amend § 50 of the
Legislative Law to require
that copies of fiscal notes required pursuant to § 50 be signed by
appropriate actuary, and filed with both the Assembly Journal Clerk
and Senate Journal Clerk.

JUSTIFICATION:
Existing Legislative Law § 50 requires any bill which
enacts or amends any provision of law relating to a retirement system
or plan of the State of New York or any of its political subdivisions
shall contain a fiscal note stating the estimated annual cost to the
employer affected and the source of such estimate. However, this
statute contains no provision requiring the actual estimates, signed
by the actuary, to be filed with any particular official. Such a
requirement would facilitate public access to these fiscal estimates,
thereby allowing all interested parties to examine and comment upon
these important fiscal estimates.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
